experience: You and J. Roberto both know Dan Nienhauser, John Danner, and 15 others
J. Roberto can introduce you to 4 people at The Dilenschneider Group
J. Roberto worked at The Dilenschneider Group

LEEP Academies of Texas advance an educational model of high-performing, culturally-responsive, dual language schools for diverse communities.  All LEEP Academies strive to:Accelerate overall student performance across subject areas for all students,Close achievement gaps for Latino and ELL students, and Achieve full bilingual fluency and biliteracy by the end of 5th grade
Vice President, National Advancement and Strategy
Greater New York City Area and Texas

Expanded network to two new markets in Texas. CEO-level, strategic leadership counsel and Chief Development Officer for the not-for-profit charter school network. Led $20M fundraising campaign. Relationship builder for national communications and development. Executive board counsel on grassroots engagement, marketing, public relations, and specialist in Latino consumer outreach. Directed local and national media. Spokesperson for both Spanish and English language media.

Providing insight and communications strategy to mid-size and complex organizations. Developing new alliances for growth. Increasing internal capacity for teams. Developing relationships built on trust and accountability.
Senior Vice President & Chief Communications Officer

Chief Communications Officer and Senior Adviser to President/CEO; corporate spokesperson. Directed media relations strategy. Promoted strong, local, school-based community relationships in over 14 major U.S. markets; organizer for local school boards establishing new public charter schools in three markets.  Campaigner for parents to advocate and support K-12 student achievement.

Directed multiple education and not-for-profit accounts; new business development, management and oversight of strategic communications portfolios of high net-worth clients for the specialized boutique communications agency.
Assoc. Editor, The Rattler Newspaper; Lambda Chi Alpha Fraternity;
Assoc. Editor, The Rattler Newspaper; Lambda Chi Alpha Fraternity;
Facilitate and execute strategic planning for a housing community board representing 50 homes in Brooklyn, New York.
recommendations: Terrence Stecz
President at Physicians Seal, LLC
November 26, 2013, Terrence managed J. Roberto directly

I worked closely with Roberto during my time as President and CEO of Edison Learning. Roberto made significant strategic contributions to the business as we guided it out of a period of severe financial distress. One of the most important constituencies our school network served was the Hispanic community. Roberto conceived of the idea of positioning Edison Learning as a thought leader for families looking to improve the academic achievement of their students and drove a novel partnership with the University of Notre Dame that resulted in a comprehensive research study into key demographic and psycohgraphic  trends of this community. Additionally, Roberto built a strategic communication department for the first time in company history which enhanced the company's ability to communicate and advocate more effectively. Roberto as the leader of this initiative led from the front working directly with community leaders and activists regarding our most important partnerships. His deep passion for closing the achievement gap enabled him to build high trust relationships quickly and effectively.I would strongly recommend adding Roberto's talents to any C Suite looking to build stronger, more authentic relationships with the customers they serve
Terrence Stecz

Senior Vice President, Special Education Schools Group at Catapult Learning
September 27, 2013, J. Roberto worked with Todd in different groups

Todd is a team-player who understands the value of collaboration, community engagement and delivery of service to customers/clients.  His work in the school district of Philadelphia was a shining example of the power of effective management through engagement.  Working with key city and state leaders Todd helped to forge an effective educational provider model for some of the city's most challenging school environments. He is both a compelling external spokesperson and thoughtful change agent for any organization. A trusted colleague.

summary: A social activist dedicated to the life-long pursuit of peace and justice through education and co-author of our shared human narrative.  Executive leadership of K-12 schools and higher education. Strategic positioning for national organizations, including for-profit and 501(C)3 organizations. Extensive relationship building and networking, fostering alliances within the non-profit, public and private sectors to deliver innovative and imaginative outcomes in service to mission-related organizations in education, the arts and media.  Trusted leader among diverse constituencies.  National and community advocate for excellence in K-12 education, including advancing strategies for innovative schools in underserved communities.Key Skills: Fundraising and Development Strategies ♦ External Relations ♦ Public Relations ♦ Reputation Management ♦  Marketing Communications ♦  Award-winning Filmmaker ♦ Communications Across Cultures ♦ Media Relations  ♦ Thought Leadership
name: J. Roberto Gutierrez
title: CEO LEEP Academies of Texas
